channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: FirstUp: Khaleda Zia's funeral in Dhaka and other big news of the day
‘Battle of Galwan’ film teaser angers China. What happened during 2020 clash with India?
Why mass protests erupted in Iran amid currency collapse
Do you drink water from plastic bottles? Here’s why you should ditch them
How JD Vance brokered peace between Trump and Musk
Quicksplained | Who is Aviva Baig, Delhi woman engaged to Priyanka Gandhi-Vadra's son Raihan?
Ishaq Dar’s year-end presser exposes where Pakistan must introspect
item.description: The Pakistani foreign minister fumbled when a journalist pointed out to him that Pakistan’s borders with three of its four neighbours were closed. This needs Pakistan to introspect, but it is incapable of doing so

item.title: Militarised diplomacy: What Pakistan’s Libya deal reveals
item.description: Pakistan’s reported agreement with Libya illustrates the consolidation of a military-first worldview in the country’s foreign policy decision-making

item.title: Top 10 positive highlights of 2025: From science to society
item.description: The year 2025, despite chaos and disruption, also witnessed remarkable breakthroughs in health, science, environment, and social progress, offering hope for the future

item.title: Revisiting Pakistan’s nuclear programme through declassified US records
item.description: Newly declassified transcripts reveal that global leaders privately acknowledged the dangers of Pakistan’s nuclear arsenal while publicly maintaining silence

item.title: How 2025 unfolded for Africa amid political and economic uncertainty
item.description: The foundation of governance – peace, security, and stability – seemed shaken in several parts of Africa, exposing a sizable portion of its 1.4 billion population to death, danger, and untold hardships

item.title: Israel recognises Somaliland: Why India should follow suit
item.description: By standing firm in favour of Somaliland, India can counter Chinese assertion in the region and ensure a permanent gateway into Africa, as well as trade access to the continent’s second-most populous country, Ethiopia
